issue.title: Falcon and SPHINCS+ interop with BC
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
The current SPHINCS+ implementation doesn't interop with Bouncy Castle under the [R3 format](https://github.com/IETF-Hackathon/pqc-certificates/tree/master#zip-format-r3) used the PQC Certificates project of IETF hackathons. oqs-provider is unable to verify self-signed certificates produced by Bouncy Castle. This occurs despite the OIDs in [Bouncy Castle](https://github.com/bcgit/bc-java/blob/e007cbe82622e2f3d2ba0c46cceab7d504d4cf9b/core/src/main/java/org/bouncycastle/asn1/bc/BCObjectIdentifiers.java#L157C3-L157C3) matching those in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/blob/fab30c7f4bb40898aab2a967cdd6b0f990091778/oqs-template/generate.yml#L735).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
```
git clone https://github.com/IETF-Hackathon/pqc-certificates.git
# Extract provider/bc/artifacts_certs_r3.zip to providers/bc/artifacts/
cd providers/bc/
../oqs/check_r3.sh .
```

**Expected behavior**
The script should output `Y` for each certificate signed using SPHINCS+:

```
1.3.9999.6.4.13,Y
1.3.9999.6.4.16,Y
1.3.9999.6.5.10,Y
1.3.9999.6.5.12,Y
1.3.9999.6.6.10,Y
1.3.9999.6.6.12,Y
1.3.9999.6.7.13,Y
1.3.9999.6.7.16,Y
1.3.9999.6.8.10,Y
1.3.9999.6.8.12,Y
1.3.9999.6.9.10,Y
1.3.9999.6.9.12,Y
```

**Environment:**
Docker container based on image built with [`/opensll3/Dockerfile-interop`](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/blob/main/openssl3/Dockerfile-interop) from oqs-demos. The Dockerfile was modified to build oqs-provider from the interop-test branch instead of main.

- OpenSSL: 3.2.0-alpha3-dev
- oqsprovider: 0.5.2-interop
